alert.note: Alert for Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 3:27PM AKST until February 22 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches possible. * WHERE...Susitna Valley. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow begins to overspread the Susitna Valley late Monday morning. Snowfall rates are then anticipated to increase Monday afternoon and continue through Tuesday morning before tapering off and ending sometime Tuesday morning. The heaviest snow accumulations are expected in the foothills of the Alaska Range with 12 to 18 inches possible along the Parks Highway from Talkeetna north.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
